review: At first I was skeptical about how much better this would be than my existing smart TV's or blu-ray players, but it really is. It's fast, has a simple remote, and makes it convenient to watch Amazon Prime, Netflix, ShowtimeNow, and YouTube. I really like the Plex client for streaming from my HTPC, too, though I did have to pay $5 for it. (At least it's doesn't require a subscription to PlexPass, unlike my smart TV's Plex app, or the PS3's Plex app.) I don't have a Roku, so I can't compare it to that. My only regret on this is that it doesn't have a Vudu app, so I can't watch my Ultraviolet movie collection in HD with the fireTV. It does have a Flixster app, but that only supports streaming Ultraviolet movies in SD.Update:I thought of one other thing my blu-ray's Netflix app has over fireTV's:  support for 3-D content. Netflix has 3D movies that I can stream from my 3D-supporting blu-ray player. FireTV apparently does not, because it doesn't give me the option when I pick a movie known to have 3D on Netflix.
